question.system:
Parse the content provided by the user to determine modules in a system

- (dash) defines the module
/ (slash) defines a comment

You MUST response in JSON, scheme
[{name:string, value:string, comment:string}]

name: name of module
type: native|.net|python|javascript
comment: create description of the module
Be concise
question.question:
Native modules:
- WindowAppModule
- WebserverModule - Start webserver, write to Body, Header, Cookie
- TerminalModule - Terminal/Console access to run external applications
- SeleniumModule - Run a browser instance, browse a website, input values and extract content
- ScheduleModule - Sleep and time delay. Cron scheduler
- PythonModule - Runs python scripts. Parameters can be passed, parameterNames should be equal length as parameterValues. Parameter example name=%name%
- OutputModule - Outputs and writes out, to the UI a text or a variable
- MessageModule - Send and recieve private messages using Nostr protocol
- LoopModule - While, for, foreach, loops through a list
- LocalOrGlobalVariableModule - Set & Get local and static variables. Bind events to variable.
- LlmModule - Ask LLM a question and recieve and answer
- ListDictionaryModule - Add, update, delete and retrieve variables to and from a list or dictionary. It can be local variable or static/global
- HttpModule - Make Http request
- HtmlModule
- FileModule - Handle file system access
- EnvironmentSettingsModule - Various settings for the program, such as culture, date & number formatting
- DbModule - Database access, select, insert, update, delete and execute raw sql. Handles transactions
- CryptographicModule - Encrypt, descryption and hashing & verify using bcrypt, compute Sha256Hash, generate & validate Bearer token
- ConditionalModule - Manages if conditions for the user request. Example 1:'if %isValid% is true then', this condition would return true if %isValid% is true. Example 2:'if %address% is empty then', this would check if the %address% variable is empty and return true if it is, else false.
- CodeModule - Generate c# code from user description. Only use if no other module is found
- CallGoalModule - Call another Goal, when ! is prefixed, e.g. !RenameFile
- BlockchainModule - Use blockchain, create wallet, account info, transfer money, sign message, verify signature

question.system:
Parse user command.

Select the correct function from list of available functions based on user command

variable is defined with starting and ending %, e.g. %filePath%

If there is some api key, settings, config replace it with %Settings.Get("settingName", "defaultValue", "Explain")%
where the settingName would be the api key, config key, 
defaultValue is the usual value given, make it "" if no value can be default
Explain is an explanation about the setting that novice user can understand.

Inputs: are parameters that are required for the function and %variables% needed
Outputs: Dictionary<string, string> where key is type of return, value is variable name, if function is not void. Use best matching defined variable, override the variable if needed
FunctionName: Name of the function to use from list of functions, if no function matches set as "N/A"


You MUST respond in JSON, scheme
 "Action": {
  "FunctionName": "String",
  "Inputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  },
  "Outputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  }
}

Only return the call name, other code will go through the list
Variable: is the name of the variable
You MUST respond in JSON, scheme:
{CallGoal:string, Variable:string}

Be Concise.e

question.assistant:
This is a list of modules you can choose from
## list starts ##
WindowAppModule(Native module for managing window applications)
, WebserverModule(Start webserver, write to Body, Header, Cookie)
, TerminalModule(Terminal/Console access to run external applications)
, SeleniumModule(Run a browser instance, browse a website, input values and extract content)
, ScheduleModule(Sleep and time delay. Cron scheduler)
, PythonModule(Runs python scripts. Parameters can be passed, parameterNames should be equal length as parameterValues. Parameter example name=%name%)
, OutputModule(Outputs and writes out, to the UI a text or a variable)
, MessageModule(Send and recieve private messages using Nostr protocol)
, LoopModule(While, for, foreach, loops through a list)
, LocalOrGlobalVariableModule(Set & Get local and static variables. Bind events to variable.)
, LlmModule(Ask LLM a question and recieve and answer)
, ListDictionaryModule(Add, update, delete and retrieve variables to and from a list or dictionary. It can be local variable or static/global)
, HttpModule(Make Http request)
, HtmlModule(Module for handling HTML content)
, FileModule(Handle file system access)
, EnvironmentSettingsModule(Various settings for the program, such as culture, date & number formatting)
, DbModule(Database access, select, insert, update, delete and execute raw sql. Handles transactions)
, CryptographicModule(Encrypt, descryption and hashing & verify using bcrypt, compute Sha256Hash, generate & validate Bearer token)
, ConditionalModule(Manages if conditions for the user request. Example 1:'if %isValid% is true then', this condition would return true if %isValid% is true. Example 2:'if %address% is empty then', this would check if the %address% variable is empty and return true if it is, else false.)
, CodeModule(Generate c# code from user description. Only use if no other module is found)
, CallGoalModule(Call another Goal, when ! is prefixed, e.g. !RenameFile)
, BlockchainModule(Use blockchain, create wallet, account info, transfer money, sign message, verify signature)

## list ends ##

question.system:
Parse user command.

Select the correct function from list of available functions based on user command

variable is defined with starting and ending %, e.g. %filePath%

If there is some api key, settings, config replace it with %Settings.Get("settingName", "defaultValue", "Explain")%
where the settingName would be the api key, config key, 
defaultValue is the usual value given, make it "" if no value can be default
Explain is an explanation about the setting that novice user can understand.

Inputs: are parameters that are required for the function and %variables% needed
Outputs: Dictionary<string, string> where key is type of return, value is variable name with %, if function is not void. Use best matching defined variable, override the variable if needed
FunctionName: Name of the function to use from list of functions, if no function matches set as "N/A"


You MUST respond in JSON, scheme
 "Action": {
  "FunctionName": "String",
  "Inputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  },
  "Outputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  }
}

If there is some api key, settings, config replace it with %Settings.Get("settingName", "defaultValue", "Explain")%
where the settingName would be the api key, config key, 
defaultValue is the usual value given, make it "" if no value can be default
Explain is an explanation about the setting that novice user can understand.

Inputs: are parameters that are required for the function and %variables% needed
Outputs: Dictionary<string, string> where key is type of return, value is variable name with %, if function is not void. Use best matching defined variable, override the variable if needed
FunctionName: Name of the function to use from list of functions, if no function matches set as "N/A"


You MUST respond in JSON, scheme
 "Action": {
  "FunctionName": "String",
  "Inputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  },
  "Outputs": {
    "key": "String",
    "value": "Object"
  }
}

This is a list of modules you can choose from
## list starts ##
WindowAppModule(Native module for window applications)
, WebserverModule(Start webserver, write to Body, Header, Cookie)
, TerminalModule(Terminal/Console access to run external applications)
, SeleniumModule(Run a browser instance, browse a website, input values and extract content)
, ScheduleModule(Sleep and time delay. Cron scheduler)
, PythonModule(Runs python scripts. Parameters can be passed, parameterNames should be equal length as parameterValues. Parameter example name=%name%)
, OutputModule(Outputs and writes out, to the UI a text or a variable. In console, code can ask user and he gives response)
, MessageModule(Send and recieve private messages using Nostr protocol)
, LoopModule(While, for, foreach, loops through a list)
, LocalOrGlobalVariableModule(Set & Get local and static variables. Bind events to variable.)
, LlmModule(Ask LLM a question and recieve and answer)
, ListDictionaryModule(Add, update, delete and retrieve variables to and from a list or dictionary. It can be local variable or static/global)
, HttpModule(Make Http request)
, HtmlModule(Native module for handling HTML)
, FileModule(Handle file system access)
, EnvironmentSettingsModule(Various settings for the program, such as culture, date & number formatting)
, DbModule(Database access, select, insert, update, delete and execute raw sql. Handles transactions)
, CryptographicModule(Encrypt, descryption and hashing & verify using bcrypt, compute Sha256Hash, generate & validate Bearer token)
, ConditionalModule(Manages if conditions for the user request. Example 1:'if %isValid% is true then', this condition would return true if %isValid% is true. Example 2:'if %address% is empty then', this would check if the %address% variable is empty and return true if it is, else false.)
, CodeModule(Generate c# code from user description. Only use if no other module is found)
, CallGoalModule(Call another Goal, when ! is prefixed, e.g. !RenameFile)
, BlockchainModule(Use blockchain, create wallet, account info, transfer money, sign message, verify signature)

## list ends ##
